description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Mobile Broadband Driver Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-30021):

1. Download and install the relevant update packages for your system from the Microsoft Update Catalog:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64-based Systems): [KB5037771](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037771)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2 (x64-based Systems): [KB5037771](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037771)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2 (x64-based Systems): [KB5037770](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037770)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64-based Systems): [KB5037768](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037768)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64-based Systems): [KB5037768](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037768)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (32-bit Systems): [KB5037768](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037768)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (32-bit Systems): [KB5037768](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037768)

2. Restart your system after installation to apply the updates effectively.

**Details**:
- The updates address a critical integer overflow or wraparound issue in the Windows Mobile Broadband driver that could allow for remote code execution. 
- Users are encouraged to check their current Windows version and the applicable build numbers before proceeding with the installation.
- Backup critical data before applying the updates to avoid data loss in the event of any issues during installation.
